revised_title: Observations on the Late Comet in September and October 1757
tldr: In this article, D. Klinkenberg shares his observations of the comet that appeared in September and October 1757. He discusses the comet's path, perihelion, and orbit, and compares it to previous comets. Klinkenberg also mentions his pendulum clock observations and the potential influence of the earth's motion on the clock's accuracy.
